headline: Essential Security Checks for Modern Apps

digest_items.title: Enable database encryption at rest
digest_items.why: Unencrypted databases are vulnerable if storage media is compromised
digest_items.fix: Enable Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) or equivalent for your database

digest_items.title: Implement data classification
digest_items.why: Classification ensures appropriate security controls for sensitive data
digest_items.fix: Label data as public, internal, confidential, or restricted

digest_items.title: Implement DMARC policy
digest_items.why: DMARC builds on SPF and DKIM to give domain owners control over email authentication

digest_items.title: Review user access permissions
digest_items.why: Stale permissions from former employees pose security risk
digest_items.fix: Conduct quarterly access reviews and remove unnecessary permissions

digest_items.title: Implement password complexity requirements
digest_items.why: Weak passwords are easily cracked by brute force attacks
digest_items.fix: Require minimum 12 characters with mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, symbols

digest_items.title: Verify SSL certificate validity
digest_items.why: Expired certificates break HTTPS and expose users to MITM attacks
digest_items.fix: Set up automated renewal with Let's Encrypt or monitor expiry dates

digest_items.title: Use secure cookie flags
digest_items.why: Insecure cookies can be stolen via XSS or transmitted over HTTP
digest_items.fix: Set HttpOnly, Secure, and SameSite flags on all cookies

digest_items.title: Use TLS 1.3 exclusively
digest_items.why: Older TLS versions have known vulnerabilities and weaker cipher suites
digest_items.fix: Update server config to disable TLS 1.0, 1.1, 1.2 and enable only TLS 1.3
